title: Zee27
author: Zee27
content: Hi guys, I don't know if there's a dedicated thread where new projects can be analysed by members of this forum to determine if they're worth investing in or not. Can we begin with Tectum blockchain? Currently listed on Mexc, CoinHarbour, Bitget, and Bitmart. It's also listed on DEX including RocketX, SushiSwap, Open Ocean and OKX Dex.This blockchain boasts of being the fastest blockchain with 1.38 million TPS. Boasts of being the first transaction-less payment system etc.Has a flagship product known as "Soft Note" which is a digital currency.I'll include the link to its website so anyone who wishes to give an analysis about it can see more information. https://softnote.com/Subsequently new projects will be added to this thread

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Try looking up a currency called Tumin - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tumin_(currency). It is a currency developed by a small town in Mexico. But a motorcycle guy in Austin is trying to develop it into a cryptocurrency, so that we would have a crypto that had hard cash behind it - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ErBAwoWfmA.

comments.author: Zee27
comments.body: Quote from: BADecker on August 21, 2023, 11:28:38 PMTry looking up a currency called Tumin - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tumin_(currency). It is a currency developed by a small town in Mexico. But a motorcycle guy in Austin is trying to develop it into a cryptocurrency, so that we would have a crypto that had hard cash behind it - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ErBAwoWfmA.This started out as an experiment...do you think there's a future in this?

comments.author: rodskee

Can we begin with Tectum blockchain? Currently listed on Mexc, CoinHarbour, Bitget, and Bitmart. It's also listed on DEX including RocketX, SushiSwap, Open Ocean and OKX Dex.This blockchain boasts of being the fastest blockchain with 1.38 million TPS. Boasts of being the first transaction-less payment system etc.Has a flagship product known as "Soft Note" which is a digital currency.I'll include the link to its website so anyone who wishes to give an analysis about it can see more information. https://softnote.com/Subsequently new projects will be added to this thread I don't know what others do but me? though i am not engaging in new projects but once i decide to partake in one, I will make sure to directly ask this forum instead of assuming and speculating , I believe in many accounts here that has deep understanding on what is going on or what will gonna happen in each project as they can see the future(of course expert speculations)anyway , you said there are new projects that will be added here but seems you are not bumpingthis thread of yours , haven't found any yet?

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: @OP.Seems to me that if you use paper Softnotes (at https://softnote.com/), you still need to verify the person you receive the notes from. Why? Because a good counterfeiter could make any number of the same note he has received. So, the receiver needs to verify every note.Fiat counterfeiters make loads of fake cash all the time. It's not verifiable unless you, the receiver of the cash, verify it with a bank.With Tectum Softcoin, since you are going to get a new code when you become the receiver, there is no need for a Softcoin 'dollar' bill. Just print the hashes out on a sheet of paper and trade sheets of paper... since you will be going through the verification process with the Tectum blockchain, anyway, just to get your new, private 'code' as the new owner.Is there a way to simplify this process? Perhaps some kind of QR or bar code, so you can scan it with your phone?
